title: [feature request] assure no Nan is entered
body_html:
I just faced a problem that my output of a model was always Nan when in eval mode, I debugged the model to find out that inside a batchnorm layer the running variance had Nan. This is a model I loaded from somewhere.
somewhere in my code I have this line :
batchnorm.running_var = torch.from_numpy(A_np_ndarray)
I think the code could be made more idiot proof by checking inside a setter of any of the values is Nan

body:
I just faced a problem that my output of a model was always Nan when in eval mode, I debugged the model to find out that inside a batchnorm layer the running variance had Nan. This is a model I loaded from somewhere.
somewhere in my code I have this line :
batchnorm.running_var = torch.from_numpy(A_np_ndarray)
I think the code could be made more idiot proof by checking inside a setter of any of the values is Nan
